critique: This document pertains to the regulation of the alcoholic beverage wholesale industry following the repeal of Prohibition. It is an executive order by Franklin D. Roosevelt approving amendments to the Code of Fair Competition for the Alcoholic Beverage Wholesale Industry under the authority of the National Industrial Recovery Act. Here's an analysis of its political bias:  1. Ideological Tilt: The document reflects a moderate liberal approach (+2) as it involves government intervention in the economy through industry regulation, a hallmark of FDR's New Deal policies.  2. Immigration Approach: This document has no bearing on immigration, so it is neutral (0).  3. Executive Power: The document expands executive power (+3) as it utilizes the authority granted to the President by the National Industrial Recovery Act to approve and modify industry codes.  4. Federalism: The document strengthens federal control (+3) as it centralizes the regulation of the alcoholic beverage industry at the national level.  5. National Security vs. Civil Liberties: The document has no direct implications for national security or civil liberties, so it is neutral (0).  6. Economic Regulation: The document promotes government intervention in the economy (+4) through the regulation of the alcoholic beverage wholesale industry.  7. Social Inclusion: The document does not directly address social inclusion issues, so it is neutral (0).
